content.webTitle: Cricket: County Championship guide First Division – Yorkshire

fields.headline: County Championship preview: Yorkshire
fields.bodyText: Big year for Jonathan Bairstow Will attract interest if he breaks into the side in his first year on staff as a batsman In a nutshell England's omission of Matthew Hoggard pronounces that his international career is over, and it will need a Hoggard county swansong plus a dry summer for spinners Adil Rashid, Azeem Rafiq and David Wainwright to mask pace bowling deficiencies Ashes factor Michael Vaughan lifted the urn on 12 September, 2005 – will he line up at the Swalec Stadium on 8 July? Headingley, of course, will host the fourth Test Foreign flavour Rana Naved is approaching veteran status and did little last season to disprove the theory that Sussex, not Yorkshire, saw the best years of him Well I never After work on the outfield, the final piece of turf – Yorkshire-grown, naturally – was only laid at Headingley last week David Hopps Bob Willis's verdict All eyes will be on Michael Vaughan and he may well be whisked away for the Ashes, but until then he will concentrate on Yorkshire's fortunes. Adil Rashid was their top performer with the ball last year but he needs more support in the attack. Will be battling to avoid relegation Captain Anthony McGrath Director of Professional Cricket Martyn Moxon 2008: Championship 7th (Div 1) Pro40 2nd (Div 2) Friends Provident semi-finals Twenty20 Cup quarter-finals (scrubbed) In Azeem Rafiq, Jonathan Bairstow, Lee Hodgson (Surrey) Out Darren Gough (retired, but could play Twenty20), Mark Lawson (Derbyshire), Greg Wood (released) Overseas Rana Naved (Pak)
